items.content_html:
Denver's Chicano Movement Legacy ProjectMultiple groups organized a demonstration at a park the community calls La Raza Park, formerly known as Columbus Park, in Denver on Saturday.

denver.cbslocal.com|By CBS Denver

Denver Chicano Groups Protest Police Brutality, Racism & Park Name

Multiple groups organized a demonstration at a park the community calls La Raza Park, formerly known as Columbus Park, in Denver on Saturday.Multiple groups organized a demonstration at a park the community calls La Raza Park, formerly known as Columbus Park, in Denver on Saturday.

items.title: Denver's Chicano Movement  Legacy ProjectDenver, CO - On August 29, over 100 people gathered in La Raza Park in Denver to commemorate the...
items.content_html:
Denver's Chicano Movement Legacy ProjectDenver, CO - On August 29, over 100 people gathered in La Raza Park in Denver to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the Chicano Moratorium and to express solidarity with current movements against police brutality and for social justice.

fightbacknews.org

Denver commemorates 50th Anniversary of Chicano Moratorium

Denver, CO - On August 29, over 100 people gathered in La Raza Park in Denver to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the Chicano Moratorium and to express solidarity with current movements against police brutality and for social justice.Denver, CO - On August 29, over 100 people gathered in La Raza Park in Denver to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the Chicano Moratorium and to express solidarity with current movements against police brutality and for social justice.

items.title: Aug.29, 2020 commemorating 50 years of renaming KKKlombus park...
items.content_html:
Denver's Chicano Movement Legacy Project

Aug.29, 2020 commemorating 50 years of renaming KKKlombus park to La Raza Park and 50 yrs. of the National Chicano Moratorium police attack on 30,000 Chicano and supporter peace marrchers.

They protested to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the day when 30,000 Chicanos gathered in East Los Angeles to protest the "high casualty rate of Chicanos in the Vietnam War."

news.yahoo.com

Chicano Groups Organize Protest In Denver On Saturday

They protested to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the day when 30,000 Chicanos gathered in East Los Angeles to protest the "high casualty rate of Chicanos in the Vietnam War."They protested to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the day when 30,000 Chicanos gathered in East Los Angeles to protest the "high casualty rate of Chicanos in the Vietnam War."

items.title: Origins of Chicano education rights in Colorado.
items.content_html:
Denver's Chicano Movement Legacy Project

Origins of Chicano education rights in Colorado.

George Autobee shared a link to the group: Chicano History: Revisited.The Maestas case represents the earliest known school desegregation case in the United States involving Latinos.

chalkbeat.org

Mexican Americans in Colorado fought an early school desegregation case

The Maestas case represents the earliest known school desegregation case in the United States involving Latinos.The Maestas case represents the earliest known school desegregation case in the United States involving Latinos.

items.title: Denver's Chicano Movement  Legacy ProjectA woman of culture and compassion, Juanita Dominguez contributed much to the Chicano Movement of...
items.content_html:
Denver's Chicano Movement Legacy ProjectA woman of culture and compassion, Juanita Dominguez contributed much to the Chicano Movement of the 1970s. She wrote “Yo Soy Chicano”— the movement song that accompanied so many activities and occasions throughout the Southwest—and published numerous articles about her community. Poet and e...

historycolorado.org

La Cultura y El Movimiento: Juanita Dominguez | History Colorado

A woman of culture and compassion, Juanita Dominguez contributed much to the Chicano Movement of the 1970s. She wrote “Yo Soy Chicano”— the movement song that accompanied so many activities and occasions throughout the Southwest—and published numerous articles about her community. Poet and e...A woman of culture and compassion, Juanita Dominguez contributed much to the Chicano Movement of the 1970s.
